title.narrative: Improved postharvest management of fruit and vegetables in the southern Philippines

description.narrative: Vegetable consumption in the southern Philippines is very low, resulting in public health issues. The low consumption is partly due to the current high prices and poor availability of fresh produce. Postharvest losses are a major problem for producers and the value chain in the Philippines, ranging from 20-30% between harvest and retail and an additional 10-40% at retail. This project aims to determine where and why these losses occur and develop strategies to reduce losses and improve product quality. The focus will be on selected fruit and vegetables including mango, jackfruit, tomato, bitter melon, cabbage and leafy vegetables. Women, traditionally regarded as the ‘traders’, will particularly be targeted through assisting farmer cooperative groups. Building capacity of researchers, technical staff and supply chain actors in the southern Philippines is also a major objective of this project.
